description: Pumpkin custard is the ideal dessert for anyone who loves the filling in pumpkin pie.
headline: Easy Pumpkin Custard

HowtoTip.text: Ingredients: Make sure you are purchasing a can of 100% pure pumpkin purée, not a can of prepared pumpkin pie mix. Storage: Cover cooled custards with plastic wrap and refrigerate for up to 3 days. Dollop with whipped cream and garnish with candied pecans and pumpkin spice just before serving.

name: Easy Pumpkin Custard

recipeInstructions.text: Arrange a rack in the middle of the oven and heat the oven to 350°F.

Place 1 (15-ounce) can pumpkin purée, 1 cup half-and-half, 2/3 cup packed brown sugar, 2 large eggs, 1 1/2 teaspoons pumpkin pie spice, and 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt in a stand mixer (or place in a large bowl if using an electric hand mixer or sturdy whisk). Beat with the paddle attachment until smooth.

Coat 6 (8-ounce) ramekins with cooking spray. Evenly divide the custard batter between the ramekins. Place the ramekins in a large baking pan with high sides. Pour enough hot water into the pan, being careful not to get any water into the ramekins, to come 1 inch up the sides of the baking pan.

Carefully transfer the baking pan to the oven. Bake uncovered until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 1 hour to 1 hour 5 minutes. (This is a good time to make the candied pecans.) Transfer the ramekins to a wire rack. Let cool until slightly warm, or cool completely and refrigerate until chilled.

Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper. Place 1/2 cup packed brown sugar, 2 tablespoons water, 1/2 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice, and 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt in a small nonstick frying pan over medium heat. Cook, stirring often, until the sugar dissolves and the mixture is bubbly, 2 to 3 minutes.
Add 1/2 cup pecan halves and 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract. Cook, stirring constantly, for 3 minutes.
Pour the pecans onto the baking sheet. Spread out in a single layer, separating the pecans. Let cool completely. Break apart any pecans that have stuck together with your hands.
To serve, top each custard with some of the candied pecans, a dollop of whipped cream, and a dusting of pumpkin pie spice.
